definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
disgrace/dishonor/to insult/to bring disgrace or humiliation to/to be indebted to/self-deprecating/Taiwan pr. [ru4]

sentences.english: The idea of being a burden to you and your sister is mortifying.
sentences.chinese: 對你和你姐姐來說是一個負擔的想法讓他們感到受辱。

sentences.english: She will be avenged on him for an insult sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 她遲早會爲受辱對他進行報復。

sentences.english: He resolved not to be pilloried beside her on her pedestal of shame.
sentences.chinese: 他決心不同她在那受辱臺上並肩而立。

sentences.english: He avenged the insult by refusing to give money to the scheme.
sentences.chinese: 他拒絕向該計劃捐款，藉此爲自己受辱進行報復。

sentences.english: I felt "dissed. " Each answer burned me and I felt publicly shamed and humiliated.
sentences.chinese: 每一個回答都讓我惱火，讓我感覺當衆受辱。

sentences.english: Take charge of a book unbearable humiliate, jump into well.
sentences.chinese: 司書不堪受辱，就跳井了。

sentences.english: Let them be dismayed and shamed forever; let them perish in disgrace.
sentences.chinese: 使他們永遠受辱恐慌，叫他們個個蒙羞喪亡。

sentences.english: He feels humiliated when someone calls him "Credit Card Slave."
sentences.chinese: 當有人叫他卡奴時，他覺得很受辱。

sentences.english: The insult still rankled in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他對那次受辱仍耿耿於懷。

sentences.english: I don't know whether to be chuffed or insulted.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道是感到開心呢還是受辱。

sentences.english: And the delusions of their magic art were put down, and their boasting of wisdom was reproachfully rebuked.
sentences.chinese: 他們的邪術盡失效力，他們誇耀的學識，全蒙恥受辱。

definition: disgrace/dishonor/to insult/to bring disgrace or humiliation to/to be indebted to/self-deprecating/Taiwan pr. [ru4]
to bear humiliation to save one's skin (idiom)
to die tragically/to meet with a violent death
to be wronged/to be subjected to an injustice
to meet with disaster/killed/in the clutches of the enemy/to fall foul of/in danger
